instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2390: What is 820-2390? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power but green light on charger
threads.message:
Hi. i have board with i can't fix it myself and need some help. i watched Louis video about  bad capacitor but i have voltage  on L7770 pin 2
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S5_MCP</SIGNAL>  -  1.10v but  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> is  0.00v and board don't powering up. Can anybody help me here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power but green light on charger
threads.message: i have 3.4v  on pin 21 on <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> but on pin 4 <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> is 0.00v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power but green light on charger
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power but green light on charger
threads.message: Have you gone down the rest of the power rails to see what is missing? When you hit the power button on the keyboard does <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> pulse for a second? You might need a second set of hands for this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power but green light on charger
threads.message: no i checked only to <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> no more. i will check rest now. thx

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power but green light on charger
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> no puls when i press power button

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> -3.61v

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> - 0.00v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.34v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> - 0.00v  
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_S0</SIGNAL> - 0.00v
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S0</SIGNAL> - 0.00v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL> - 0.00v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8R1V5_S3</SIGNAL> - 0.01v
<SIGNAL>PPMCPDDR_ISNS</SIGNAL> - 0.02v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power but green light on charger
threads.message: Is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3_RTC</SIGNAL> present? What is the history of this, water, drop, or something else? This could really be anything at this point, needs some more information to be able to advise. No <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> pulse could be almost anything.
